revision.text:
{{Infobox Key Item |name = Gem Case |image = [[File:ShardCase_HighRes.png]] |caption = Artwork of the ''Gem Case''. |use = Allows collection of [[Gems]] |obtain = Defeat [[Kanto|Giovanni]] }} Gems are an item dropped when defeating any kind of Pokémon once the player has the [[Gem Case]] unlocked. These typed Gems can be invested into the Gems tab to increase type effectivity, and your damage output. ===Upgrades=== {| class="wikitable sortable collapsible" |- ! To Purchase Level !! Gem Cost |- | 1 || 500 |- | 2 || 1000 |- | 3 || 1500 |- | 4 || 2000 |- | 5 || 2500 |- | 6 || 3000 |- | 7 || 3500 |- | 8 || 4000 |- | 9 || 4500 |- | 10 || 5000 |- | Sum Total || 27,500 |} ==Methods== ===Helpful tips=== The Gems you get from defeating a Pokémon depend on the type(s) that Pokémon has. Wild Pokémon on routes give 1 Gem per type, dungeon encounters give 3, most gym/trainer Pokémon give 5, and dungeon bosses give 20. Note: Gyms yield 5 Gems per Pokémon, but not every pokemon in a gym will be the appropriate type. The most efficient gyms yield the most Gems per gym clear. (e.g. Violet City Gym is less efficient than the Petalburg City Gym because it takes twice as many clears of the Violet City Gym to obtain the same number of Gems). ===Gem Optimization=== Note: In the table below, Gems are listed in pokemon type order, and the gyms are listed in the normal gym order, and '''gyms in bold''' are considered to be the most efficient gyms. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! rowspan=2 | Gem Type ! colspan=2 | Routes ! colspan=3 | Gyms |- ! Route !! Chance ! Efficient Gyms (Trainer) !! Amount !! Percentage of Pokemon that Drop Gems |- | ! rowspan=3 | [[File:Normal_Gem.png|15px]] Normal || Kanto 1 || ! rowspan=3 |100% || [[Gyms#Johto|Violet Gym]] || 10 || 100% |- | Kanto 16 || '''[[Gyms#Hoenn|Petalburg Gym]]''' || '''20''' || '''100%''' |- | Kalos 1 || [[Gyms#Unova|Aspertia Gym]] ||15||100% |- |! {{Infobox Key Item |name = Gem Case |image = [[File:ShardCase_HighRes.png]] |caption = Artwork of the ''Gem Case''. |use = Allows collection of [[Gems]] |obtain = Defeat [[Kanto|Giovanni]] }} Gems are an item dropped when defeating any kind of Pokémon once the player has the [[Gem Case]] unlocked. These typed Gems can be invested into the Gems tab to increase type effectivity, and your damage output. ===Upgrades=== {| class="wikitable sortable collapsible" |- ! To Purchase Level !! Gem Cost |- | 1 || 500 |- | 2 || 1000 |- | 3 || 1500 |- | 4 || 2000 |- | 5 || 2500 |- | 6 || 3000 |- | 7 || 3500 |- | 8 || 4000 |- | 9 || 4500 |- | 10 || 5000 |- | Sum Total || 27,500 |} ==Methods== ===Helpful tips=== The Gems you get from defeating a Pokémon depend on the type(s) that Pokémon has. Wild Pokémon on routes give 1 Gem per type, dungeon encounters give 3, most gym/trainer Pokémon give 5, and dungeon bosses give 20. Note: Gyms yield 5 Gems per Pokémon, but not every pokemon in a gym will be the appropriate type. The most efficient gyms yield the most Gems per gym clear. (e.g. Violet City Gym is less efficient than the Petalburg City Gym because it takes twice as many clears of the Violet City Gym to obtain the same number of Gems). ===Gem Optimization=== Note: In the table below, Gems are listed in pokemon type order, and the gyms are listed in the normal gym order, and '''gyms in bold''' are considered to be the most efficient gyms. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! rowspan=2 | Gem Type ! colspan=2 | Routes ! colspan=3 | Gyms |- ! Route !! Chance ! Efficient Gyms (Trainer) !! Amount !! revision.comment: CooldudeOmega0 moved page [[Shards]] to [[Gems]]: outdated name

revision.text:
{{Infobox Key Item |name = Gem Case |image = [[File:ShardCase_HighRes.png]] |caption = Artwork of the ''Gem Case''. |use = Allows collection of [[Gems]] |obtain = Defeat [[Kanto|Giovanni]] }} Gems are an item dropped when defeating any kind of Pokémon once the player has the [[Gem Case]] unlocked. These typed Gems can be invested into the Gems tab to increase type effectivity, and your damage output. ===Upgrades=== {| class="wikitable sortable collapsible" |- ! To Purchase Level !! Gem Cost |- | 1 || 500 |- | 2 || 1000 |- | 3 || 1500 |- | 4 || 2000 |- | 5 || 2500 |- | 6 || 3000 |- | 7 || 3500 |- | 8 || 4000 |- | 9 || 4500 |- | 10 || 5000 |- | Sum Total || 27,500 |} ==Methods== ===Helpful tips=== The Gems you get from defeating a Pokémon depend on the type(s) that Pokémon has. Wild Pokémon on routes give 1 Gem per type, dungeon encounters give 3, most gym/trainer Pokémon give 5, and dungeon bosses give 20. Note: Gyms yield 5 Gems per Pokémon, but not every pokemon in a gym will be the appropriate type. The most efficient gyms yield the most Gems per gym clear. (e.g. Violet City Gym is less efficient than the Petalburg City Gym because it takes twice as many clears of the Violet City Gym to obtain the same number of Gems). ===Gem Optimization=== Note: In the table below, Gems are listed in pokemon type order, and the gyms are listed in the normal gym order, and '''gyms in bold''' are considered to be the most efficient gyms. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! rowspan=2 | Gem Type ! colspan=2 | Routes ! colspan=3 | Gyms |- ! Route !! Chance ! Efficient Gyms (Trainer) !! Amount !! Percentage of Pokemon that Drop Gems |- | ! rowspan=3 | [[File:Normal_Gem.png|15px]] Normal || Kanto 1 || ! rowspan=3 |100% || [[Gyms#Johto|Violet Gym]] || 10 || 100% |- | Kanto 16 || '''[[Gyms#Hoenn|Petalburg Gym]]''' || '''20''' || '''100%''' |- | Kalos 1 || [[Gyms#Unova|Aspertia Gym]] ||15||100% |- |!
